revision.comment: Bot edit: This page will appear as today's featured article in the near future
revision.text: {{ArticleHistory |action1=GAN |action1date=22:30, 31 October 2010 |action1link=Talk:Russian battleship Sevastopol (1895)/GA1 |action1result=listed |action1oldid=394030044 |action2=WPR |action2date=19 December 2010 |action2link=Wikipedia:WikiProject Military history/Peer review/Russian battleship Sevastopol (1895) |action2result=reviewed |action2oldid=400491289 |action3=WAR |action3date=06:24, 17 January 2011 (UTC) |action3link=Wikipedia:WikiProject Military history/Assessment/Russian battleship Sevastopol (1895)/archive1 |action3result=Not Approved |action3oldid=407843105 |action4=WAR |action4date=07:28, 21 April 2011 (UTC) |action4link=Wikipedia:WikiProject Military history/Assessment/Russian battleship Sevastopol (1895) |action4result=Approved |action4oldid=425013974 |action5=FAC |action5date=16:56, 12 June 2011 |action5link=Wikipedia:Featured article candidates/Russian battleship Sevastopol (1895)/archive1 |action5result=not promoted |action5oldid=433641161 |action6=FAC |action6date=18:52, 20 September 2011 |action6link=Wikipedia:Featured article candidates/Russian battleship Sevastopol (1895)/archive2 |action6result=not promoted |action6oldid=450696832 |action7=FAC |action7date=01:20, 20 October 2011 |action7link=Wikipedia:Featured article candidates/Russian battleship Sevastopol (1895)/archive3 |action7result=promoted |action7oldid=455996951 |action8=GTC |action8date=16:24, 17 December 2012 (UTC) |action8link=Wikipedia:Featured topic candidates/Petropavlovsk class battleships/archive1 |action8result=promoted |ftname=Petropavlovsk class battleships |dykdate=7 October 2010 |dykentry=... that the Russian [[battleship]] '''''[[Russian battleship Sevastopol (1895)|Sevastopol]]''''' was the only battleship not [[Marine salvage|salvaged]] by the Japanese at [[Siege of Port Arthur|Port Arthur]], following destruction of the [[Russian Pacific Fleet|Russian Fleet]]? |topic=War and military |currentstatus=FA |maindate=March 3, 2014 |four=yes }} {{WikiProjectBannerShell|1= {{WPMILHIST|class=FA|B1=yes|B2=yes|B3=yes|B4=yes|B5=yes|old-peer-review=yes|A-Class=pass|Russian=y|Maritime=y}} {{WPSHIPS|class=FA|B1=yes|B2=yes|B3=yes|B4=yes|B5=yes}} {{WPRUSSIA|class=FA|importance=low|mil=yes|hist=yes|tech=yes}} }} == Condition of ship at start of August 9th == In the section "Wartime service", it says that the Sevastopol "was not fully repaired, having one inoperable 12 inch gun turret in her aft." I think this needs re-wording. But, does it mean that one of the two guns in the aft turret was inoperable, or that the entire turret was inoperable? --[[User:Demiurge1000|Demiurge1000]] ([[User talk:Demiurge1000|talk]]) 21:36, 26 September 2010 (UTC) Also, in the same section, it says that the admiral "ordered six separate waves of destroyers to sink the battleship, some of which were launched from the Fuji and Mikasa". This makes it sound as if the destroyers were launched by the Fuji and the Mikasa? Does it in fact mean that the Fuji and Mikasa also launched some torpedoes, as well as the destroyers launching torpedoes? --[[User:Demiurge1000|Demiurge1000]] ([[User talk:Demiurge1000|talk]]) 21:57, 26 September 2010 (UTC) :I've fixed both problems. [[User:Buggie111|Buggie111]] ([[User talk:Buggie111|talk]]) 23:51, 26 September 2010 (UTC) == Two things == Bum sentence: "Immediately after the surrender of Port Arthur, Sevastopol was scuttled to prevent her capture by the Imperial Japanese Navy and never raised." Can it be fixed, please? Also, I footnoted the Cyrillic equivalent of the ship's name, since it seems hardly necesary on en.WP to clutter the opening with the phonetically same rendering in a script English-speakers don't know. But the number is kind of big, so please revert if you don't like it. [[User:Tony1|'''Tony''']] [[User talk:Tony1|(talk)]] 11:15, 23 October 2011 (UTC) :I've fixed and reverted. [[User:Buggie111|Buggie111]] ([[User talk:Buggie111|talk]]) 14:32, 23 October 2011 (UTC)
